name: Kölner Freiwilligen Agentur
description: The Cologne Volunteer Agency places volunteers in over 400 projects in the city – from reading programs and language support to environmental activities.

name: Caritasverband für die Stadt Köln e.V.
description: The Caritas Association offers a variety of volunteering opportunities in areas such as neighborhood aid, family sponsorships, and support for refugees.

name: Diakonie Michaelshoven
description: Diakonie Michaelshoven offers volunteers opportunities in community assistance, senior companionship, and donation support services.

name: AWO Köln – Büro für Bürgerengagement
description: AWO Cologne connects volunteers with social and cultural projects, including reading mentorships, refugee assistance, and senior care.

name: Kinderschutzbund Köln
description: The Cologne Child Protection Association enables volunteers to work on youth helplines, family mentoring, and parenting courses.

name: Caritas-Freiwilligenagentur impuls
description: The Caritas agency connects volunteers to projects in neighborhood support, integration, education, and environmental action.

name: AWO Düsseldorf – Ehrenamtsbörse
description: AWO Düsseldorf provides various opportunities in social work, education, cultural programs, and integration support.

name: DRK Düsseldorf
description: The German Red Cross in Düsseldorf enables volunteering in emergency services, social support, and legal assistance.

name: NABU Düsseldorf
description: NABU Düsseldorf offers environmental volunteering and education projects for nature enthusiasts.

name: MachMit – Freiwilligenzentrale der Diakonie Düsseldorf
description: The MachMit volunteer center connects people with social and cultural engagements including mentoring and support initiatives.

name: Freiwillig.hamburg
description: Hamburg’s central volunteer portal with over 2,000 opportunities – from neighborhood help and reading mentorships to environmental projects.

name: Freiwilligenagentur mittig engagiert
description: This agency places volunteers in education, culture, and social projects across central Hamburg.

name: NABU Hamburg
description: NABU Hamburg focuses on conservation work and environmental education with a variety of volunteer activities.

name: Freiwilligenagentur Hamburg-Bergedorf
description: This agency coordinates volunteers in district-based education, culture, and community support projects.

name: BUND Hamburg
description: BUND Hamburg offers opportunities in environmental protection and nature-based education programs.

name: Landesfreiwilligenagentur Berlin
description: The Landesfreiwilligenagentur Berlin serves as a central hub for volunteer engagement in Berlin, offering consultation, training, and support for volunteers and organizations across various social and cultural projects.

name: FreiwilligenAgentur Mitte
description: FreiwilligenAgentur Mitte connects volunteers with opportunities in Berlin's central district, focusing on social support, education, and cultural initiatives.

name: Freiwilligenagentur Marzahn-Hellersdorf
description: This agency supports volunteers and organizations in the Marzahn-Hellersdorf district, facilitating engagement in social, educational, and cultural projects.

name: Freiwilligenagentur Steglitz-Zehlendorf
description: The Steglitz-Zehlendorf volunteer agency offers guidance and placement for individuals seeking to engage in community service, education, and cultural activities in the district.

name: Freiwilligen-Agentur Tatendrang
description: Tatendrang connects volunteers with over 400 organizations in Munich, offering opportunities in social care, education, and cultural projects, along with personalized consultation and training.

name: Z'sam – Zentrum für freiwilliges Engagement
description: Z'sam serves as a center for voluntary engagement in Munich, providing support and matching volunteers with social and educational initiatives.

name: Freiwilligen-Zentren München
description: The Freiwilligen-Zentren München offer local consultation and placement services for volunteers across various districts, focusing on family, youth, education, and cultural projects.

name: Stiftung Gute Tat
description: Stiftung Gute Tat facilitates volunteer engagement in Munich, offering a variety of short-term and flexible opportunities in social care and education.
